lines.content: >   "I have no special talent. I am only passionately curious." -  Albert Einstein [(source)](https://github.com/dwyl/quotes)
Bingus is a task management application based on [Project Duke](https://nus-cs2103-ay1920s1.github.io/website/se-book-adapted/projectDuke/index.html).
* __deadline <task-name> \by <dd-MM-yyyy HH:mm>:__ Adds a new Deadline task.
+ __event <task-name> \from <dd-MM-yyyy HH:mm> \to <dd-MM-yyyy HH:mm>:__ Adds a new Event item.
+ __mark <task-number>:__ Marks task at index <task-number> as done.
+ __unmark <task-number>:__ Marks task at index <task-number> as not done.
+ __find <task-name>:__ Finds task with matching keywords of <task-name>.
2. mark the taks as done or not
3. record deadlines and durations of deadlines and events!

* @param to End date of the task.

Bingus is a cat-themed chatbot designed to record and manage your tasks, deadlines and events so ypu can see them in a clear concise manner.
> 1. Words in `UPPER_CASE` are the parameters to be supplied by the user.
>    e.g. in `todo DESCRIPTION`, `DESCRIPTION` is a parameter which can be used as `todo Add Project Increment`.
> 2. Items in square brackets are optional.
>    e.g. in `event DESCRIPTION [/tentative]`, the argument `/tentative` is optional.
> 3. Tokens starting with `/` refers to a parameter name. Parameters can be in any order.
>    e.g. If the command specifies, `/from FROM /to TO`, `/to TO /from FROM` is also acceptable.

This command deletes a task from the task list.
Now you have 4 tasks in the list.
## Finding all tasks with a keyword: `find`
This command finds all tasks whose description contains a keyword.
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
This command add a priority to your tasks.
